title: Starliner Return Delayed Yet Again

title: NASA and Boeing Delay Starliner Return Again Again Again

title: Starliner return delayed to July
summary: NASA and Boeing have pushed back the return of the CST-100 Starliner spacecraft from the International Space Station until at least early July to continue studies of propulsion system problems.

title: NASA indefinitely delays return of Starliner to review propulsion data
summary: “We are letting the data drive our decision."

title: GOES-U nears launch with a new sun sensor
summary: The primary difference between the geostationary weather satellite scheduled to launch June 25 and its predecessors is its solar-viewing instrument.

title: Lockheed Martin secures $977.5 million contract extension for missile-warning satellites
summary: The latest award brings the total value of Lockheed Martin’s contract for the Next-Generation Overhead Persistent Infrared satellite program to $8.2 billion

title: NASA’s SLS Rocket: Block 1 vs. Block 1B Configuration
summary: NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket in the Block 1B cargo configuration will launch for the first time beginning with Artemis IV. This upgraded and more powerful SLS rocket will enable SLS to send over 38 metric tons (83,700 lbs.) to the Moon, including NASA’s Orion spacecraft and its crew, along with heavy payloads for […]
